content.question: A circuit containing a <math alttext="20 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math> battery, a <math alttext="100 ohm" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Î©</mi></math> resistor, a capacitor, an inductor, and two switches is shown in the diagram. When Switch <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has been closed for a long time, the charge stored on the capacitor is <math alttext="0.25 coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></math>. Switch <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is then opened, and Switch <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is closed. The period of oscillation of the charge stored on the capacitor with Switch <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> open and Switch <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> closed is <math alttext="2.0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>. What is the inductance of the inductor?

topic.text: 13.6: Circuits with Capacitors and Inductors (LC Circuits)

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
